newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks seen falling on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks seen falling on profit-taking.

text.p: Shares on the Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) were called to open lower on Thursday on profit-taking after a week-long rally, brokers said.

"The share prices are expected to decline amid a market correction. The investors have already started booking profit after a persistent rise in share prices over the past several sessions," said broker Khurshid Alam.
Brokers said investors would remain cautious after a steep rise in most blue chip shares. The DSE benchmark index closed 74.46 points or 6.64 percent down at 1,045.41 on Wednesday.
